hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation Cascade Reversal Signal
hypothesis_content.statement: When large liquidations ($400M+ in 24h) coincide with negative news catalyst, the subsequent 6-hour period shows reliable reversal patterns if: (1) liquidation heatmap shows cluster exhaustion, (2) perpetual funding resets to neutral/positive, and (3) spot exchange inflows spike (whale accumulation).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Large liquidation events often create oversold conditions as forced selling exhausts. When combined with spot accumulation signals, this creates high-probability reversal setups as markets digest the forced selling.
entry_conditions: Negative news catalyst identified (macro, regulatory, etc.)
Funding rates reset to ≥0% after being negative
Spot exchange net inflows >$50M in 2h period post-cascade
Price holds above previous liquidation cluster low by ≥1.5%

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% gain from entry or return to pre-cascade VWAP

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Markets continue trending down after meeting all entry conditions in >30% of historical cases across regimes.
